chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett appeared by video.  
Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Makaelon Rodney Bennett. 
Attorney  William Ackell for Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case in court for a scheduling Conference.  
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Jon Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for an Arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
State will forward defense a Global Offer. Defense request time to retrieve and review with defendant.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 45 for arraignment.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Arraignment scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Makaelon Rodney Bennett in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Makaelon Rodney Bennett in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Makaelon Rodney Bennett appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
